name: SPDR S&P 500 Momentum ETF
description: The SPDR S&P 500 Momentum ETF (SPYM) is an exchange-traded fund that aims to track the performance of the S&P 500 Momentum Index. Launched in 2017, the ETF focuses on companies within the S&P 500 that have shown strong price momentum over a specific period. By investing in SPYM, investors gain exposure to a diversified portfolio of high-momentum stocks, which can potentially offer superior returns compared to the broader market. The fund utilizes a systematic approach to select its holdings based on momentum, providing investors with a tactical investment strategy that capitalizes on market trends. SPYM is designed for investors looking to enhance their equity exposure with a focus on momentum investing, offering liquidity, transparency, and cost-effectiveness associated with ETFs. The fund is managed by State Street Global Advisors, one of the largest asset management firms in the world, ensuring professional management and oversight. With its focus on high-growth companies, SPYM is suited for investors who are willing to embrace the inherent volatility of momentum investing in pursuit of higher long-term returns.
ceo: Cathy R. A. H. R. P. L. J. B. C. J.

key_executives.name: Cathy R. A. H. R. P. L. J. B. C. J.

seo.meta_title: SPDR S&P 500 Momentum ETF (SPYM) | Invest in Momentum Stocks
seo.meta_description: Explore the SPDR S&P 500 Momentum ETF (SPYM) and invest in a diversified portfolio of high-momentum stocks from the S&P 500 Index.

faq.question: What is SPYM?
faq.answer: SPYM is the SPDR S&P 500 Momentum ETF that tracks the performance of the S&P 500 Momentum Index.

faq.question: Who manages SPYM?
faq.answer: SPYM is managed by State Street Global Advisors.

faq.question: What is the investment strategy of SPYM?
faq.answer: SPYM focuses on investing in companies with strong price momentum in the S&P 500 Index.

faq.question: Where is SPYM headquartered?
faq.answer: SPYM is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, USA.
